    show "b = finprod G (Œªx. x [^] f x) A" by fact
    have "x [^] f x ‚àà generate G {x}" if "x ‚àà A" for x
      using generate_pow[of x] assms(1) that by blast
    thus "(Œªx. x [^] f x) ‚àà (Œ† a‚ààA. generate G {a})" unfolding Pi_def by blast
  qed
next
  case False
  hence b: "b = ùü≠" using assms(7) unfolding finprod_def by simp
  from False assms(3) have "infinite B" by simp
  hence a: "a = ùü≠" using assms(6) unfolding finprod_def by simp
  show "a ‚àà generate G B" using generate.one a by blast
  show "b ‚àà generate G A" using generate.one b by blast
qed

text ‚ÄπWe can characterize a complementary family of subgroups when the only way to form the neutral
element as a product of picked elements from each subgroup is to pick the neutral element from each
subgroup.‚Ä∫

lemma (in comm_group) compl_fam_imp_triv_finprod:
  assumes "compl_fam S I" "finite I" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ subgroup (S i) G"
  and "finprod G f I = ùü≠" "f ‚àà Pi I S"
  shows "‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠"
proof (rule ccontr; clarify)
  from assms(5) have f: "f i ‚àà (S i)" if "i ‚àà I" for i using that by fastforce
  fix i
  assume i: "i ‚àà I"
  have si: "subgroup (S i) G" using assms(3)[OF i] .
  consider (triv) "(S i) = {ùü≠}" | (not_triv) "(S i) ‚â† {ùü≠}" by blast
  thus "f i = ùü≠"
  proof (cases)
    case triv
    then show ?thesis using f[OF i] by blast
  next
    case not_triv
    show ?thesis
    proof (rule ccontr)
      have fc: "f i ‚àà carrier G" using f[OF i] subgroup.subset[OF si] by blast
      assume no: "f i ‚â† ùü≠"
      have fH: "f i ‚àà (S i)" using f[OF i] .
      from subgroup.m_inv_closed[OF si this] have ifi: "inv (f i) ‚àà (S i)" .
      moreover have "inv (f i) ‚â† ùü≠" using no fc by simp
      moreover have "inv (f i) = finprod G f (I - {i})"
      proof -
        have "ùü≠ = finprod G f I" using assms(4) by simp
        also have "‚Ä¶ = finprod G f (insert i (I - {i}))"
        proof -
          have "I = insert i (I - {i})" using i by fast
          thus ?thesis by simp
        qed
        also have "‚Ä¶ = f i ‚äó finprod G f (I - {i})"
        proof(intro finprod_insert)
          show "finite (I - {i})" using assms(2) by blast
          show "i ‚àâ I - {i}" by blast
          show "f ‚àà I - {i} ‚Üí carrier G" using assms(3) f subgroup.subset by blast
          show "f i ‚àà carrier G" by fact
        qed
        finally have o: "ùü≠ = f i ‚äó finprod G f (I - {i})" .
        show ?thesis
        proof(intro inv_equality)
          show "f i ‚àà carrier G" by fact
          show "finprod G f (I - {i}) ‚àà carrier G"
            by (intro finprod_closed; use assms(3) f subgroup.subset in blast)
          from m_comm[OF this fc] o show "finprod G f (I - {i}) ‚äó f i = ùü≠" by simp
        qed
      qed
      moreover have "finprod G f (I - {i}) ‚àà IDirProds G S (I - {i})"
      proof (intro finprod_closed_subgroup IDirProds_is_subgroup)
        show "‚ãÉ (S ` (I - {i})) ‚äÜ carrier G" using assms(3) subgroup.subset by auto
        have "f j ‚àà (IDirProds G S (I - {i}))" if "j ‚àà (I - {i})" for j
          using IDirProds_incl[OF that] f that by blast
        thus "f ‚àà I - {i} ‚Üí IDirProds G S (I - {i})" by blast
      qed
      ultimately have "¬¨complementary (S i) (IDirProds G S (I - {i}))"
        unfolding complementary_def by auto
      thus False using assms(1) i unfolding compl_fam_def by blast
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma (in comm_group) triv_finprod_imp_compl_fam:
  assumes "finite I" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ subgroup (S i) G"
  and "‚àÄf ‚àà Pi I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠)"
  shows "compl_fam S I"
proof (unfold compl_fam_def; rule)
  fix k
  assume k: "k ‚àà I"
  let ?DP = "IDirProds G S (I - {k})"
  show "complementary (S k) ?DP"
  proof (rule ccontr; unfold complementary_def)
    have sk: "subgroup (S k) G" using assms(2)[OF k] .
    have sDP: "subgroup ?DP G"
      by (intro IDirProds_is_subgroup; use subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)] in blast)
    assume a: "(S k) ‚à© IDirProds G S (I - {k}) ‚â† {ùü≠}"
    then obtain x where x: "x ‚àà (S k)" "x ‚àà IDirProds G S (I - {k})" "x ‚â† ùü≠"
      using subgroup.one_closed sk sDP by blast
    then have "x ‚àà (Œªx. finprod G x (I - {k})) ` (Pi (I - {k}) S)"
      using IDirProds_eq_finprod_Pi[of "(I - {k})"] assms(1, 2) by blast
    then obtain ht where ht: "finprod G ht (I - {k}) = x" "ht ‚àà Pi (I - {k}) S" by blast
    define h where h: "h = (ht(k := inv x))"
    then have hPi: "h ‚àà Pi I S" using ht subgroup.m_inv_closed[OF assms(2)[OF k] x(1)] by auto
    have "finprod G h (I - {k}) = x"
    proof (subst ht(1)[symmetric], intro finprod_cong)
      show "I - {k} = I - {k}" by simp
      show "(h ‚àà I - {k} ‚Üí carrier G) = True" using h ht(2) subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)]
        unfolding Pi_def id_def by auto
      show "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I - {k} =simp=> h i = ht i" using ht(2) h by simp
    qed
    moreover have "finprod G h I = h k ‚äó finprod G h (I - {k})"
      by (intro finprod_minus; use k assms hPi subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)] Pi_def in blast)
    ultimately have "finprod G h I = inv x ‚äó x" using h by simp
    then have "finprod G h I = ùü≠" using subgroup.subset[OF sk] x(1) by auto
    moreover have "h k ‚â† ùü≠" using h x(3) subgroup.subset[OF sk] x(1) by force
    ultimately show False using assms(3) k hPi by blast
  qed
qed

lemma (in comm_group) triv_finprod_iff_compl_fam_Pi:
  assumes "finite I" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ subgroup (S i) G"
  shows "compl_fam S I ‚ü∑ (‚àÄf ‚àà Pi I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠))"
  using compl_fam_imp_triv_finprod triv_finprod_imp_compl_fam assms by blast

lemma (in comm_group) triv_finprod_iff_compl_fam_PiE:
  assumes "finite I" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ subgroup (S i) G"
  shows "compl_fam S I ‚ü∑ (‚àÄf ‚àà Pi‚á©E I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠))"
proof
  show "compl_fam S I ‚üπ ‚àÄf‚ààPi‚á©E I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠)"
    using triv_finprod_iff_compl_fam_Pi[OF assms] by auto
  have "‚àÄf‚ààPi‚á©E I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠)
    ‚üπ ‚àÄf‚ààPi I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠)"
  proof(rule+)
    fix f i
    assume f: "f ‚àà Pi I S" "finprod G f I = ùü≠" and i: "i ‚àà I"
    assume allf: "‚àÄf‚ààPi‚á©E I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠)"
    have "f i = restrict f I i" using i by simp
    moreover have "finprod G (restrict f I) I = finprod G f I"
      using f subgroup.subset[OF assms(2)] unfolding Pi_def by (intro finprod_cong; auto)
    moreover have "restrict f I ‚àà Pi‚á©E I S" using f by simp
    ultimately show "f i = ùü≠" using allf f i by metis
  qed
  thus "‚àÄf‚ààPi‚á©E I S. finprod G f I = ùü≠ ‚ü∂ (‚àÄi‚ààI. f i = ùü≠) ‚üπ compl_fam S I"
    using triv_finprod_iff_compl_fam_Pi[OF assms] by presburger
qed

text ‚ÄπThe finite product also distributes when nested.‚Ä∫

(* Manuel Eberl, TODO: move to library *)
lemma (in comm_monoid) finprod_Sigma:
  assumes "finite A" "‚ãÄx. x ‚àà A ‚üπ finite (B x)"
  assumes "‚ãÄx y. x ‚àà A ‚üπ y ‚àà B x ‚üπ g x y ‚àà carrier G"
  shows   "(‚®Çx‚ààA. ‚®Çy‚ààB x. g x y) = (‚®Çz‚ààSigma A B. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y)"
  using assms
proof (induction A rule: finite_induct)
  case (insert x A)
  have "(‚®Çz‚ààSigma (insert x A) B. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y) =
          (‚®Çz‚ààPair x ` B x. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y) ‚äó (‚®Çz‚ààSigma A B. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y)"
    unfolding Sigma_insert using insert.prems insert.hyps
    by (subst finprod_Un_disjoint) auto
  also have "(‚®Çz‚ààSigma A B. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y) = (‚®Çx‚ààA. ‚®Çy‚ààB x. g x y)"
    using insert.prems insert.hyps by (subst insert.IH [symmetric]) auto
  also have "(‚®Çz‚ààPair x ` B x. case z of (x, y) ‚áí g x y) = (‚®Çy‚ààB x. g x y)"
    using insert.prems insert.hyps by (subst finprod_reindex) (auto intro: inj_onI)
  finally show ?case
    using insert.hyps insert.prems by simp
qed auto

text ‚ÄπWith the now proven facts, we are able to provide criterias to inductively construct a
group that is the internal direct product of a set of generators.‚Ä∫

(* belongs to IDirProd, but uses finprod stuff *)
lemma (in comm_group) idirprod_generate_ind:
  assumes "finite gs" "gs ‚äÜ carrier G" "g ‚àà carrier G"
          "is_idirprod (generate G gs) (Œªg. generate G {g}) gs"
          "complementary (generate G {g}) (generate G gs)"
  shows "is_idirprod (generate G (gs ‚à™ {g})) (Œªg. generate G {g}) (gs ‚à™ {g})"
proof(cases "g ‚àà gs")
  case True
  hence "gs = (gs ‚à™ {g})" by blast
  thus ?thesis using assms(4) by auto 
next
  case gngs: False
  show ?thesis
  proof (intro is_idirprod_subgroup_suffices)
    have gsgc: "gs ‚à™ {g} ‚äÜ carrier G" using assms(2, 3) by blast
    thus "generate G (gs ‚à™ {g}) = IDirProds G (Œªg. generate G {g}) (gs ‚à™ {g})"
      unfolding IDirProds_def using generate_idem_Un by presburger
    show "‚àÄi‚ààgs ‚à™ {g}. subgroup (generate G {i}) G" using generate_is_subgroup gsgc by auto
    have sg: "subgroup (generate G {g}) G" by (intro generate_is_subgroup, use assms(3) in blast)
    from assms(4) is_idirprod_def have ih: "‚àÄx. x ‚àà gs ‚ü∂ generate G {x} ‚ä≤ G"
                                           "compl_fam (Œªg. generate G {g}) gs"
      by fastforce+
    hence ca: "complementary (generate G {a}) (generate G (gs - {a}))" if "a ‚àà gs" for a
      unfolding compl_fam_def IDirProds_def
      using gsgc generate_idem_Un[of "gs - {a}"] that by fastforce
    have aux: "gs ‚à™ {g} - {i} ‚äÜ carrier G" for i using gsgc by blast
    show "compl_fam (Œªg. generate G {g}) (gs ‚à™ {g})"
    proof(unfold compl_fam_def IDirProds_def, subst generate_idem_Un[OF aux],
          rule, rule ccontr)
      fix h
      assume h: "h ‚àà gs ‚à™ {g}"
      assume c: "¬¨ complementary (generate G {h}) (generate G (gs ‚à™ {g} - {h}))"
      show "False"
      proof (cases "h = g")
        case True
        with c have "¬¨ complementary (generate G {g}) (generate G (gs - {g}))" by auto
        moreover have "complementary (generate G {g}) (generate G (gs - {g}))"
          by (rule subgroup_subset_complementary[OF generate_is_subgroup generate_is_subgroup[of gs]
                   generate_is_subgroup mono_generate], use assms(2, 3, 5) in auto)
        ultimately show False by blast
      next
        case hng: False
        hence h: "h ‚àà gs" "h ‚â† g" using h by blast+
        hence "gs ‚à™ {g} - {h} = gs - {h} ‚à™ {g}" by blast
        with c have c: "¬¨ complementary (generate G {h}) (generate G (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g}))" by argo
        then obtain k where k: "k ‚àà generate G {h}" "k ‚àà generate G (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g})" "k ‚â† ùü≠"
          unfolding complementary_def using generate.one by blast 
        with ca have kngh: "k ‚àâ generate G (gs - {h})" using h unfolding complementary_def by blast
        from k(2) generate_eq_finprod_PiE_image[of "gs - {h} ‚à™ {g}"] assms(1) gsgc
        obtain f where f:
          "k = finprod G f (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g})" "f ‚àà (Œ†‚á©E a‚ààgs - {h} ‚à™ {g}. generate G {a})"
          by blast
        have fg: "f a ‚àà generate G {a}" if "a ‚àà (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g})" for a using that f(2) by blast
        have fc: "f a ‚àà carrier G" if "a ‚àà (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g})" for a
        proof -
          have "generate G {a} ‚äÜ carrier G" if "a ‚àà (gs - {h} ‚à™ {g})" for a
            using that generate_incl[of "{a}"] gsgc by blast
          thus "f a ‚àà carrier G" using that fg by auto
        qed
        have kp: "k = f g ‚äó finprod G f (gs - {h})"
        proof -
          have "(gs - {h} ‚à™ {g}) = insert g (gs - {h})" by fast
          moreover have "finprod G f (insert g (gs - {h})) = f g ‚äó finprod G f (gs - {h})"
            by (intro finprod_insert, use fc assms(1) gngs in auto)
          ultimately show ?thesis using f(1) by argo
        qed
        have fgsh: "finprod G f (gs - {h}) ‚àà generate G (gs - {h})"
        proof(intro finprod_closed_subgroup[OF generate_is_subgroup])
          show "gs - {h} ‚äÜ carrier G" using gsgc by blast
          have "f a ‚àà generate G (gs - {h})" if "a ‚àà (gs - {h})" for a
            using mono_generate[of "{a}" "gs - {h}"] fg that by blast
          thus "f ‚àà gs - {h} ‚Üí generate G (gs - {h})" by blast
        qed
        have "f g ‚äó finprod G f (gs - {h}) ‚àâ generate G gs"
        proof
          assume fpgs: "f g ‚äó finprod G f (gs - {h}) ‚àà generate G gs"
          from fgsh have fgsgs: "finprod G f (gs - {h}) ‚àà generate G gs"
            using mono_generate[of "gs - {h}" gs] by blast
          have fPi: "f ‚àà (Œ† a‚àà(gs - {h}). generate G {a})" using f by blast
          have gI: "generate G (gs - {h})
                  = (Œªx. finprod G x (gs - {h})) ` (Œ† a‚ààgs - {h}. generate G {a})"
            using generate_eq_finprod_Pi_image[of "gs - {h}"] assms(1, 2) by blast
          have fgno: "f g ‚â† ùü≠"
          proof (rule ccontr)
            assume o: "¬¨ f g ‚â† ùü≠"
            hence kf: "k = finprod G f (gs - {h})" using kp finprod_closed fc by auto
            hence "k ‚àà generate G (gs - {h})" using fPi gI by blast
            thus False using k ca h unfolding complementary_def by blast
          qed
          from fpgs have "f g ‚àà generate G gs"
            using subgroup.mult_in_cancel_right[OF generate_is_subgroup[OF assms(2)] fc[of g] fgsgs]
            by blast
          with fgno assms(5) fg[of g] show "False" unfolding complementary_def by blast
        qed
        moreover have "k ‚àà generate G gs" using k(1) mono_generate[of "{h}" gs] h(1) by blast
        ultimately show False using kp by blast
      qed
    qed
  qed
qed

end

Theory Group_Hom

(*
    File:     Group_Hom.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU M√ºnchen
*)
section ‚ÄπGroup Homomorphisms‚Ä∫

theory Group_Hom
  imports Set_Multiplication
begin

text ‚ÄπThis section extends the already existing library about group homomorphisms in HOL-Algebra by
some useful lemmas. These were mainly inspired by the needs that arised throughout the other proofs.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) generate_hom:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ carrier G"
  shows "h ` (generate G A) = generate H (h ` A)"
  using assms group_hom.generate_img group_hom_axioms by blast

text ‚ÄπFor two elements with the same image we can find an element in the kernel that maps one of the
two elements on the other by multiplication.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) kernel_assoc_elem:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier G" "y ‚àà carrier G" "h x = h y"
  obtains z where "x = y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô z" "z ‚àà kernel G H h"
proof -
  have c: "inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x ‚àà carrier G" using assms by simp
  then have e: "x = y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô (inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x)" using assms G.m_assoc
    using G.inv_solve_left by blast
  then have "h x = h (y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô (inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x))" by simp
  then have "h x = h y ‚äó‚áòH‚áô h (inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x)" using c assms by simp
  then have "ùü≠‚áòH‚áô = h (inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x)" using assms by simp
  then have "(inv y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô x) ‚àà kernel G H h" unfolding kernel_def using c by simp
  thus ?thesis using e that by blast
qed

text ‚ÄπThis can then be used to characterize the pre-image of a set $A$ under homomorphism as a
product of $A$ itself with the kernel of the homomorphism.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) vimage_eq_set_mult_kern_right:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ carrier G"
  shows "{x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà h ` A} = A <#> kernel G H h"
proof(intro equalityI subsetI)
  fix x
  assume assm: "x ‚àà A <#> kernel G H h"
  then have xc: "x ‚àà carrier G" unfolding kernel_def set_mult_def using assms by blast
  from assm obtain a b where ab: "a ‚àà A" "b ‚àà kernel G H h" "x = a ‚äó‚áòG‚áô b"
    unfolding set_mult_def by blast
  then have abc: "a ‚àà carrier G" "b ‚àà carrier G" unfolding kernel_def using assms by auto
  from ab have "h x = h (a ‚äó‚áòG‚áô b)" by blast
  also have "‚Ä¶ = h a ‚äó‚áòH‚áô h b" using abc by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = h a ‚äó‚áòH‚áô ùü≠‚áòH‚áô" using ab(2) unfolding kernel_def by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = h a" using abc by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àà h ` A" using ab by blast 
  finally have "h x ‚àà h ` A" .
  thus "x ‚àà {x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà h ` A}" using xc by blast
next
  fix x
  assume "x ‚àà {x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà h ` A}"
  then have x: "x ‚àà carrier G" "h x ‚àà h ` A" by simp+
  then obtain y where y: "y ‚àà A" "h x = h y" "y ‚àà carrier G" using assms by auto
  with kernel_assoc_elem obtain z where "x = y ‚äó‚áòG‚áô z" "z ‚àà kernel G H h" using x by metis
  thus "x ‚àà A <#> kernel G H h" unfolding set_mult_def using y by blast
qed

lemma (in group_hom) vimage_subset_generate_kern:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ carrier G"
  shows "{x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà h ` A} ‚äÜ generate G (A ‚à™ kernel G H h)"
  using vimage_eq_set_mult_kern_right[of A] G.set_mult_subset_generate[of "A" "kernel G H h"] assms
  unfolding kernel_def by blast

text ‚ÄπThe preimage of a subgroup under a homomorphism is also a subgroup.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) subgroup_vimage_is_subgroup:
  assumes "subgroup I H"
  shows "subgroup {x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà I} G" (is "subgroup ?J G")
proof
  show "?J ‚äÜ carrier G" by blast
  show "ùü≠ ‚àà ?J" using subgroup.one_closed[of I H] assms by simp
  fix x
  assume x: "x ‚àà ?J"
  then have hx: "h x ‚àà I" by blast
  show "inv x ‚àà ?J"
  proof -
    from hx have "inv‚áòH‚áô (h x) ‚àà I" using subgroup.m_inv_closed assms by fast
    moreover have "inv x ‚àà carrier G" using x by simp
    moreover have "inv‚áòH‚áô (h x) = h (inv x)" using x by auto
    ultimately show "inv x ‚àà ?J" by simp
  qed
  fix y
  assume y: "y ‚àà ?J"
  then have hy: "h y ‚àà I" by blast
  show "x ‚äó y ‚àà {x ‚àà carrier G. h x ‚àà I}"
  proof -
    have "h (x ‚äó y) = h x ‚äó‚áòH‚áô h y" using x y by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àà I" using hx hy assms subgroup.m_closed by fast
    finally have "h (x ‚äó y) ‚àà I" .
    moreover have "x ‚äó y ‚àà carrier G" using x y by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis by blast
  qed
qed

lemma (in group_hom) iso_kernel:
  assumes "h ‚àà iso G H"
  shows "kernel G H h = {ùü≠‚áòG‚áô}"
  unfolding kernel_def using assms
  using hom_one iso_iff by blast

‚úê‚Äπcontributor ‚ÄπPaulo Em√≠lio de Vilhena‚Ä∫‚Ä∫ (* adapted by Joseph Thommes *)
lemma (in group_hom) induced_group_hom_same_group: 
  assumes "subgroup I G"
  shows "group_hom (G ‚¶á carrier := I ‚¶à) H h"
proof -
  have "h ‚àà hom (G ‚¶á carrier := I ‚¶à) H"
    using homh subgroup.mem_carrier[OF assms] unfolding hom_def by auto
  thus ?thesis
    unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def
    using subgroup.subgroup_is_group[OF assms G.is_group] by simp
qed

text ‚ÄπThe order of an element under a homomorphism divides the order of the element.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) hom_ord_dvd_ord:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "H.ord (h a) dvd G.ord a"
proof -
  have "h a [^]‚áòH‚áô (G.ord a) = h (a [^]‚áòG‚áô G.ord a)"
    using assms local.hom_nat_pow by presburger
  also have "‚Ä¶ = h (ùü≠‚áòG‚áô)" using G.pow_ord_eq_1 assms by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = ùü≠‚áòH‚áô" by simp
  finally have "h a [^]‚áòH‚áô G.ord a = ùü≠‚áòH‚áô" .
  then show ?thesis using pow_eq_id assms by simp
qed

text ‚ÄπIn particular, this implies that the image of an element with a finite order also will have a
finite order.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) finite_ord_stays_finite:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "G.ord a ‚â† 0"
  shows "H.ord (h a) ‚â† 0"
  using hom_ord_dvd_ord assms by fastforce

text ‚ÄπFor injective homomorphisms, the order stays the same.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) inj_imp_ord_eq:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "inj_on h (carrier G)" "G.ord a ‚â† 0"
  shows "H.ord (h a) = G.ord a"
proof (rule antisym)
  show "H.ord (h a) ‚â§ G.ord a" using hom_ord_dvd_ord assms by force
  show "G.ord a ‚â§ H.ord (h a)"
  proof -
    have "ùü≠‚áòH‚áô = h (a [^]‚áòG‚áô H.ord(h a))" using H.pow_ord_eq_1 assms
      by (simp add: local.hom_nat_pow)
    then have "a [^]‚áòG‚áô H.ord (h a) = ùü≠‚áòG‚áô" using assms inj_on_one_iff by simp
    then have "G.ord a dvd H.ord (h a)" using G.pow_eq_id assms(1) by blast
    thus ?thesis using assms finite_ord_stays_finite by fastforce
  qed
qed

lemma (in group_hom) one_in_kernel:
  "ùü≠ ‚àà kernel G H h"
  using subgroup.one_closed subgroup_kernel by blast

lemma hom_in_carr:
  assumes "f ‚àà hom G H"
  shows "‚ãÄx. x ‚àà carrier G ‚üπ f x ‚àà carrier H"
  using assms unfolding hom_def bij_betw_def by blast

lemma iso_in_carr:
  assumes "f ‚àà iso G H"
  shows "‚ãÄx. x ‚àà carrier G ‚üπ f x ‚àà carrier H"
  using assms unfolding iso_def bij_betw_def by blast

lemma triv_iso:
  assumes "group G" "group H" "carrier G = {ùü≠‚áòG‚áô}" "carrier H = {ùü≠‚áòH‚áô}"
  shows "G ‚âÖ H"
proof(unfold is_iso_def iso_def)
  interpret G: group G by fact
  interpret H: group H by fact
  let ?f = "Œª_. ùü≠‚áòH‚áô"
  have "?f ‚àà hom G H" by (intro homI, auto)
  moreover have "bij_betw ?f (carrier G) (carrier H)" unfolding bij_betw_def
    using assms(3, 4) by auto
  ultimately show "{h ‚àà hom G H. bij_betw h (carrier G) (carrier H)} ‚â† {}" by blast
qed

text ‚ÄπThe cardinality of the image of a group homomorphism times the cardinality of its kernel is
equal to the group order. This is basically another form of Lagrange's theorem.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group_hom) image_kernel_product: "card (h ` (carrier G)) * card (kernel G H h) = order G" 
proof -
  interpret G: group G by simp
  interpret H: group H by simp
  interpret ih: subgroup "h ` (carrier G)" H using img_is_subgroup by blast
  interpret ih: group "H‚¶ácarrier := h ` (carrier G)‚¶à" using subgroup.subgroup_is_group by blast
  interpret h: group_hom G "H‚¶ácarrier := h ` (carrier G)‚¶à"
    by (unfold_locales, unfold hom_def, auto)
  interpret k: subgroup "kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h" G using h.subgroup_kernel by blast
  from h.FactGroup_iso
  have "G Mod kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h ‚âÖ H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à" by auto
  hence "card (h ` (carrier G)) = order (G Mod kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h)"
    using iso_same_card unfolding order_def by fastforce
  moreover have "order (G Mod kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h)
                 * card (kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h) = order G"
    using G.lagrange[OF k.subgroup_axioms] unfolding order_def FactGroup_def by force
  moreover have "kernel G (H‚¶ácarrier := h ` carrier G‚¶à) h = kernel G H h"
    unfolding kernel_def by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by argo
qed

end

Theory Finite_And_Cyclic_Groups

(*
    File:     Finite_And_Cyclic_Groups.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU M√ºnchen; Manuel Eberl, TU M√ºnchen
*)
section ‚ÄπFinite and cyclic groups‚Ä∫

theory Finite_And_Cyclic_Groups
  imports Group_Hom Generated_Groups_Extend General_Auxiliary
begin

subsection ‚ÄπFinite groups‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπWe define the notion of finite groups and prove some trivial facts about them.‚Ä∫

locale finite_group = group +
  assumes fin[simp]: "finite (carrier G)"

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in finite_group) ord_pos: 
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier G"
  shows   "ord x > 0"
  using ord_ge_1[of x] assms by auto

lemma (in finite_group) order_gt_0 [simp,intro]: "order G > 0"
  by (subst order_gt_0_iff_finite) auto

lemma (in finite_group) finite_ord_conv_Least:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "ord x = (LEAST n::nat. 0 < n ‚àß x [^] n = ùü≠)"
  using pow_order_eq_1 order_gt_0_iff_finite ord_conv_Least assms by auto

lemma (in finite_group) non_trivial_group_ord_gr_1:
  assumes "carrier G ‚â† {ùü≠}"
  shows "‚àÉe ‚àà carrier G. ord e > 1"
proof -
  from one_closed obtain e where e: "e ‚â† ùü≠" "e ‚àà carrier G" using assms carrier_not_empty by blast
  thus ?thesis using ord_eq_1[of e] le_neq_implies_less ord_ge_1 by fastforce
qed

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in finite_group) max_order_elem:
  obtains a where "a ‚àà carrier G" "‚àÄx ‚àà carrier G. ord x ‚â§ ord a"
proof -
  have "‚àÉx. x ‚àà carrier G ‚àß (‚àÄy. y ‚àà carrier G ‚ü∂ ord y ‚â§ ord x)"
  proof (rule ex_has_greatest_nat[of _ ùü≠ _ "order G + 1"], safe)
    show "ùü≠ ‚àà carrier G"
      by auto
  next
    fix x assume "x ‚àà carrier G"
    hence "ord x ‚â§ order G"
      by (intro ord_le_group_order fin)
    also have "‚Ä¶ < order G + 1"
      by simp
    finally show "ord x < order G + 1" .
  qed
  thus ?thesis using that by blast
qed

lemma (in finite_group) iso_imp_finite:
  assumes "G ‚âÖ H" "group H"
  shows "finite_group H"
proof -
  interpret H: group H by fact
  show ?thesis
  proof(unfold_locales)
    show "finite (carrier H)" using iso_same_card[OF assms(1)]
      by (metis card_gt_0_iff order_def order_gt_0)
  qed
qed

lemma (in finite_group) finite_FactGroup:
  assumes "H ‚ä≤ G"
  shows "finite_group (G Mod H)"
proof -
  interpret H: normal H G by fact
  interpret Mod: group "G Mod H" using H.factorgroup_is_group .
  show ?thesis
    by (unfold_locales, unfold FactGroup_def RCOSETS_def, simp)
qed

lemma (in finite_group) bigger_subgroup_is_group:
  assumes "subgroup H G" "card H ‚â• order G"
  shows "H = carrier G"
  using subgroup.subset fin assms by (metis card_seteq order_def)

text ‚ÄπAll generated subgroups of a finite group are obviously also finite.‚Ä∫

lemma (in finite_group) finite_generate:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ carrier G"
  shows "finite (generate G A)"
  using generate_incl[of A] rev_finite_subset[of "carrier G" "generate G A"] assms by simp

text ‚ÄπWe also provide an induction rule for finite groups inspired by Manuel Eberl's AFP entry
"Dirichlet L-Functions and Dirichlet's Theorem" and the contained theory "Group\_Adjoin". A property
that is true for a subgroup generated by some set and stays true when adjoining an element, is also
true for the whole group.‚Ä∫

lemma (in finite_group) generate_induct[consumes 1, case_names base adjoin]:
  assumes "A0 ‚äÜ carrier G"
  assumes "A0 ‚äÜ carrier G ‚üπ P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G A0‚¶à)"
  assumes "‚ãÄa A. ‚ü¶A ‚äÜ carrier G; a ‚àà carrier G - generate G A; A0 ‚äÜ A;
           P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G A‚¶à)‚üß ‚üπ P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G (A ‚à™ {a})‚¶à)"
  shows "P G"
proof -
  define A where A: "A = carrier G"
  hence gA: "generate G A = carrier G"
    using generate_incl[of "carrier G"] generate_sincl[of "carrier G"] by simp
  hence "finite A" using fin A by argo
  moreover have "A0 ‚äÜ A" using assms(1) A by argo
  moreover have "A ‚äÜ carrier G" using A by simp
  moreover have "generate G A0 ‚äÜ generate G A" using gA generate_incl[OF assms(1)] by argo
  ultimately have "P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G A‚¶à)" using assms(2, 3)
  proof (induction "A" taking: card rule: measure_induct_rule)
    case (less A)
    then show ?case
    proof(cases "generate G A0 = generate G A")
      case True
      thus ?thesis using less by force
    next
      case gA0: False
      with less(3) have s: "A0 ‚äÇ A" by blast
      then obtain a where a: "a ‚àà A - A0" by blast
      have P1: "P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G (A - {a})‚¶à)"
      proof(rule less(1))
        show "card (A - {a}) < card A" using a less(2) by (meson DiffD1 card_Diff1_less)
        show "A0 ‚äÜ A - {a}" using a s by blast
        thus "generate G A0 ‚äÜ generate G (A - {a})" using mono_generate by presburger
      qed (use less a s in auto)
      show ?thesis
      proof (cases "generate G A = generate G (A - {a})")
        case True
        then show ?thesis using P1 by simp
      next
        case False
        have "a ‚àà carrier G - generate G (A - {a})"
        proof -
          have "a ‚àâ generate G (A - {a})"
          proof
            assume a2: "a ‚àà generate G (A - {a})"
            have "generate G (A - {a}) = generate G A"
            proof (rule equalityI)
              show "generate G (A - {a}) ‚äÜ generate G A" using mono_generate by auto
              show "generate G A ‚äÜ generate G (A - {a})"
              proof(subst (2) generate_idem[symmetric])
                show "generate G A ‚äÜ generate G (generate G (A - {a}))"
                  by (intro mono_generate, use generate_sincl[of "A - {a}"] a2 in blast)
              qed (use less in auto)
            qed
            with False show False by argo
          qed
          with a less show ?thesis by fast
        qed
        from less(7)[OF _ this _ P1] less(4) s a have "P (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G (A - {a} ‚à™ {a})‚¶à)"
          by blast
        moreover have "A - {a} ‚à™ {a} = A" using a by blast
        ultimately show ?thesis by auto
      qed
    qed
  qed
  with gA show ?thesis by simp
qed

subsection ‚ÄπFinite abelian groups‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπAnother trivial locale: the finite abelian group with some trivial facts.‚Ä∫

locale finite_comm_group = finite_group + comm_group

lemma (in finite_comm_group) iso_imp_finite_comm:
  assumes "G ‚âÖ H" "group H"
  shows "finite_comm_group H"
proof -
  interpret H: group H by fact
  interpret H: comm_group H by (intro iso_imp_comm_group[OF assms(1)], unfold_locales)
  interpret H: finite_group H by (intro iso_imp_finite[OF assms(1)], unfold_locales)
  show ?thesis by unfold_locales
qed

lemma (in finite_comm_group) finite_comm_FactGroup:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows "finite_comm_group (G Mod H)"
  unfolding finite_comm_group_def
proof(safe)
  show "finite_group (G Mod H)" using finite_FactGroup[OF subgroup_imp_normal[OF assms]] .
  show "comm_group (G Mod H)" by (simp add: abelian_FactGroup assms)
qed

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in finite_comm_group) subgroup_imp_finite_comm_group:
  assumes "subgroup H G"
  shows   "finite_comm_group (G‚¶ácarrier := H‚¶à)"
proof -
  interpret G': group "G‚¶ácarrier := H‚¶à" by (intro subgroup_imp_group) fact+
  interpret H: subgroup H G by fact
  show ?thesis by standard (use finite_subset[OF H.subset] in ‚Äπauto simp: m_comm‚Ä∫)
qed


subsection ‚ÄπCyclic groups‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπNow, the central notion of a cyclic group is introduced: a group generated
by a single element.‚Ä∫

locale cyclic_group = group +
  fixes gen :: "'a"
  assumes gen_closed[intro, simp]: "gen ‚àà carrier G"
  assumes generator: "carrier G = generate G {gen}"

lemma (in cyclic_group) elem_is_gen_pow:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "‚àÉn :: int. x = gen [^] n"
proof -
  from generator have x_g:"x ‚àà generate G {gen}" using assms by fast
  with generate_pow[of gen] show ?thesis using gen_closed by blast
qed

text ‚ÄπEvery cyclic group is commutative/abelian.‚Ä∫

sublocale cyclic_group ‚äÜ comm_group
proof(unfold_locales)
  fix x y
  assume "x ‚àà carrier G" "y ‚àà carrier G"
  then obtain a b where ab:"x = gen [^] (a::int)" "y = gen [^] (b::int)"
    using elem_is_gen_pow by presburger
  then have "x ‚äó y = gen [^] (a + b)" by (simp add: int_pow_mult)                 
  also have "‚Ä¶ = y ‚äó x" using ab int_pow_mult
    by (metis add.commute gen_closed)
  finally show "x ‚äó y = y ‚äó x" .
qed

text ‚ÄπSome trivial intro rules for showing that a group is cyclic.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group) cyclic_groupI0:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "carrier G = generate G {a}"
  shows "cyclic_group G a"
  using assms by (unfold_locales; auto) 

lemma (in group) cyclic_groupI1:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "carrier G ‚äÜ generate G {a}"
  shows "cyclic_group G a"
  using assms by (unfold_locales, use generate_incl[of "{a}"] in auto)

lemma (in group) cyclic_groupI2:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "cyclic_group (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à) a"
proof (intro group.cyclic_groupI0)
  show "group (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à)"
    by (intro subgroup.subgroup_is_group group.generate_is_subgroup, use assms in simp_all)
  show "a ‚àà carrier (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à)" using generate.incl[of a "{a}"] by auto
  show "carrier (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à) = generate (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à) {a}"
    using assms
    by (simp add: generate_consistent generate.incl group.generate_is_subgroup)
qed

text ‚ÄπThe order of the generating element is always the same as the group order.‚Ä∫

lemma (in cyclic_group) ord_gen_is_group_order:
  shows "ord gen = order G"
proof (cases "finite (carrier G)")
  case True
  with generator show "ord gen = order G"
    using generate_pow_card[of gen] order_def[of G] gen_closed by simp
next
  case False
  thus ?thesis
    using generate_pow_card generator order_def[of G] card_eq_0_iff[of "carrier G"] by force
qed

text ‚ÄπIn the case of a finite group, it is sufficient to have one element of group order to know
that the group is cyclic.‚Ä∫

lemma (in finite_group) element_ord_generates_cyclic:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "ord a = order G"
  shows "cyclic_group G a"
proof (unfold_locales)
  show "a ‚àà carrier G" using assms(1) by simp
  show "carrier G = generate G {a}"
    using assms bigger_subgroup_is_group[OF generate_is_subgroup]
    by (metis empty_subsetI fin generate_pow_card insert_subset ord_le_group_order)
qed

text ‚ÄπAnother useful fact is that a group of prime order is also cyclic.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group) prime_order_group_is_cyc:
  assumes "Factorial_Ring.prime (order G)"
  obtains g where "cyclic_group G g"
proof (unfold_locales)
  obtain p where order_p: "order G = p" and p_prime: "Factorial_Ring.prime p" using assms by blast
  then have "card (carrier G) ‚â• 2" by (simp add: order_def prime_ge_2_nat)
  then obtain a where a_in: "a ‚àà carrier G" and a_not_one: "a ‚â† ùü≠" using one_unique
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) card_2_iff' obtain_subset_with_card_n subset_iff)
  interpret fin: finite_group G
    using assms order_gt_0_iff_finite unfolding order_def by unfold_locales auto
  have "ord a dvd p" using a_in order_p ord_dvd_group_order by blast
  hence "ord a = p" using prime_nat_iff[of p] p_prime ord_eq_1 a_in a_not_one by blast
  then interpret cyclic_group G a
    using fin.element_ord_generates_cyclic order_p a_in by simp
  show ?thesis using that cyclic_group_axioms .
qed

text ‚ÄπWhat follows is an induction principle for cyclic groups: a predicate is true for all elements
of the group if it is true for all elements that can be formed by the generating element by just
multiplication and if it also holds under the forming of the inverse (as we by this cover
all elements of the group),‚Ä∫

(* Manuel Eberl *)
lemma (in cyclic_group) generator_induct [consumes 1, case_names generate inv]:
  assumes x: "x ‚àà carrier G"
  assumes IH1: "‚ãÄn::nat. P (gen [^] n)"
  assumes IH2: "‚ãÄx. x ‚àà carrier G ‚üπ P x ‚üπ P (inv x)"
  shows   "P x"
proof -
  from x obtain n :: int where n: "x = gen [^] n"
    using elem_is_gen_pow[of x] by auto
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "n ‚â• 0")
    case True
    have "P (gen [^] nat n)"
      by (rule IH1)
    with True n show ?thesis by simp
  next
    case False
    have "P (inv (gen [^] nat (-n)))"
      by (intro IH1 IH2) auto
    also have "gen [^] nat (-n) = gen [^] (-n)"
      using False by simp
    also have "inv ‚Ä¶ = x"
      using n by (simp add: int_pow_neg)
    finally show ?thesis .
  qed
qed


subsection ‚ÄπFinite cyclic groups‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπAdditionally, the notion of the finite cyclic group is introduced.‚Ä∫

locale finite_cyclic_group = finite_group + cyclic_group

sublocale finite_cyclic_group ‚äÜ finite_comm_group
  by unfold_locales

lemma (in finite_cyclic_group) ord_gen_gt_zero:
  "ord gen > 0"
  using ord_ge_1[OF fin gen_closed] by simp

text ‚ÄπIn order to prove something about an element in a finite abelian group, it is possible to show
this property for the neutral element or the generating element and inductively for the elements
that are formed by multiplying with the generator.‚Ä∫

lemma (in finite_cyclic_group) generator_induct0 [consumes 1, case_names one step]:
  assumes x: "x ‚àà carrier G"
  assumes IH1: "P ùü≠"
  assumes IH2: "‚ãÄx. ‚ü¶x ‚àà carrier G; P x‚üß ‚üπ P (x ‚äó gen)"
  shows   "P x"
proof -
  from ord_gen_gt_zero generate_nat_pow[OF _ gen_closed] obtain n::nat where n: "x = gen [^] n"
    using generator x by blast
  thus ?thesis by (induction n arbitrary: x, use assms in auto)
qed

lemma (in finite_cyclic_group) generator_induct1 [consumes 1, case_names gen step]:
  assumes x: "x ‚àà carrier G"
  assumes IH1: "P gen"
  assumes IH2: "‚ãÄx. ‚ü¶x ‚àà carrier G; P x‚üß ‚üπ P (x ‚äó gen)"
  shows   "P x"
proof(rule generator_induct0[OF x])
  show "‚ãÄx. ‚ü¶x ‚àà carrier G; P x‚üß ‚üπ P (x ‚äó gen)" using IH2 by blast
  have "P x" if "n > 0" "x = gen [^] n" for n::nat and x using that
    by (induction n arbitrary: x; use assms in fastforce)
  from this[OF ord_pos[OF gen_closed] pow_ord_eq_1[OF gen_closed, symmetric]] show "P ùü≠" .
qed

subsection ‚Äπ‚Äπget_exp‚Ä∫ - discrete logarithm‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπWhat now follows is the discrete logarithm for groups. It is used at several times througout
this entry and is initially used to show that two cyclic groups of the same order are isomorphic.‚Ä∫

definition (in group) get_exp where
  "get_exp g = (Œªa. SOME k::int. a = g [^] k)"

text ‚ÄπFor each element with itself as the basis the discrete logarithm indeed does what expected.
This is not the strongest possible statement, but sufficient for our needs.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group) get_exp_self_fulfills:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "a = a [^] get_exp a a"
proof -
  have "a = a [^] (1::int)" using assms by auto
  moreover have "a [^] (1::int) = a [^] (SOME x::int. a [^] (1::int) = a [^] x)"
    by (intro someI_ex[of "Œªx::int. a [^] (1::int) = a [^] x"]; blast)
  ultimately show ?thesis unfolding get_exp_def by simp
qed

lemma (in group) get_exp_self:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "get_exp a a mod ord a = (1::int) mod ord a"
  by (intro pow_eq_int_mod[OF assms], use get_exp_self_fulfills[OF assms] assms in auto)

text ‚ÄπFor cyclic groups, the discrete logarithm "works" for every element.‚Ä∫

lemma (in cyclic_group) get_exp_fulfills:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "a = gen [^] get_exp gen a"
proof -
  from elem_is_gen_pow[OF assms] obtain k::int where k: "a = gen [^] k" by blast
  moreover have "gen [^] k = gen [^] (SOME x::int. gen [^] k = gen [^] x)"
    by(intro someI_ex[of "Œªx::int. gen [^] k = gen [^] x"]; blast)
  ultimately show ?thesis unfolding get_exp_def by blast
qed

lemma (in cyclic_group) get_exp_non_zero:
  assumes"b ‚àà carrier G" "b ‚â† ùü≠"
  shows "get_exp gen b ‚â† 0"
  using assms get_exp_fulfills[OF assms(1)] by auto 

text ‚ÄπOne well-known logarithmic identity.‚Ä∫

lemma (in cyclic_group) get_exp_mult_mod:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "b ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "get_exp gen (a ‚äó b) mod (ord gen) = (get_exp gen a + get_exp gen b) mod (ord gen)"
proof (intro pow_eq_int_mod[OF gen_closed])
  from get_exp_fulfills[of "a ‚äó b"] have "gen [^] get_exp gen (a ‚äó b) = a ‚äó b" using assms by simp
  moreover have "gen [^] (get_exp gen a + get_exp gen b) = a ‚äó b"
  proof -
    have "gen [^] (get_exp gen a + get_exp gen b) = gen [^] (get_exp gen a) ‚äó gen [^] (get_exp gen b)"
      using int_pow_mult by blast
    with get_exp_fulfills assms show ?thesis by simp
  qed
  ultimately show "gen [^] get_exp gen (a ‚äó b) = gen [^] (get_exp gen a + get_exp gen b)" by simp
qed

text ‚ÄπWe now show that all functions from a group generated by 'a' to a group generated by 'b'
that map elements from $a^k$ to $b^k$ in the other group are in fact isomorphisms between these two
groups.‚Ä∫

lemma (in group) iso_cyclic_groups_generate:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier G" "b ‚àà carrier H" "group.ord G a = group.ord H b" "group H"
  shows "{f. ‚àÄk ‚àà (UNIV::int set). f (a [^] k) = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k}
         ‚äÜ iso (G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à) (H‚¶ácarrier := generate H {b}‚¶à)"
proof
  interpret H: group H by fact
  let ?A = "G‚¶ácarrier := generate G {a}‚¶à"
  let ?B = "H‚¶ácarrier := generate H {b}‚¶à"
  interpret A: cyclic_group ?A a by (intro group.cyclic_groupI2; use assms(1) in simp)
  interpret B: cyclic_group ?B b by (intro group.cyclic_groupI2; use assms(2) in simp)
  have sA: "subgroup (generate G {a}) G" by (intro generate_is_subgroup, use assms(1) in simp)
  have sB: "subgroup (generate H {b}) H" by (intro H.generate_is_subgroup, use assms(2) in simp)
  fix x
  assume x: "x ‚àà {f. ‚àÄk‚àà(UNIV::int set). f (a [^] k) = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k}"
  have hom: "x ‚àà hom ?A ?B"
  proof (intro homI)
    fix c
    assume c: "c ‚àà carrier ?A"
    from A.elem_is_gen_pow[OF this] obtain k::int where k: "c = a [^] k"
      using int_pow_consistent[OF sA generate.incl[of a]] by auto
    with x have "x c = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k" by blast
    thus "x c ‚àà carrier ?B"
      using B.int_pow_closed H.int_pow_consistent[OF sB] generate.incl[of b "{b}" H] by simp
    fix d
    assume d: "d ‚àà carrier ?A"
    from A.elem_is_gen_pow[OF this] obtain l::int where l: "d = a [^] l"
      using int_pow_consistent[OF sA generate.incl[of a]] by auto
    with k have "c ‚äó d = a [^] (k + l)" by (simp add: int_pow_mult assms(1))
    with x have "x (c ‚äó‚áò?A‚áô d) = b [^]‚áòH‚áô (k + l)" by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k ‚äó‚áòH‚áô b [^]‚áòH‚áô l" by (simp add: H.int_pow_mult assms(2))
    finally show "x (c ‚äó‚áò?A‚áô d) = x c ‚äó‚áò?B‚áô x d" using x k l by simp
  qed
  then interpret xgh: group_hom ?A ?B x unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def by blast
  have "kernel ?A ?B x = {ùü≠}"
  proof(intro equalityI)
    show "{ùü≠} ‚äÜ kernel ?A ?B x" using xgh.one_in_kernel by auto
    have "c = ùü≠" if "c ‚àà kernel ?A ?B x" for c
    proof -
      from that have c: "c ‚àà carrier ?A" unfolding kernel_def by blast
      from A.elem_is_gen_pow[OF this] obtain k::int where k: "c = a [^] k"
        using int_pow_consistent[OF sA generate.incl[of a]] by auto
      moreover have "x c = ùü≠‚áòH‚áô" using that x unfolding kernel_def by auto
      ultimately have "ùü≠‚áòH‚áô = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k" using x by simp
      with assms(3) have "a [^] k = ùü≠"
        using int_pow_eq_id[OF assms(1), of k] H.int_pow_eq_id[OF assms(2), of k] by simp
      thus "c = ùü≠" using k by blast
    qed
    thus "kernel ?A ?B x ‚äÜ {ùü≠}" by blast             
  qed
  moreover have "carrier ?B ‚äÜ x ` carrier ?A"
  proof
    fix c
    assume c: "c ‚àà carrier ?B"
    from B.elem_is_gen_pow[OF this] obtain k::int where k: "c = b [^]‚áòH‚áô k"
      using H.int_pow_consistent[OF sB generate.incl[of b]] by auto
    then have "x (a [^] k) = c" using x by blast
    moreover have "a [^] k ‚àà carrier ?A"
      using int_pow_consistent[OF sA generate.incl[of a]] A.int_pow_closed generate.incl[of a]
      by fastforce
    ultimately show "c ‚àà x ` carrier ?A" by blast
  qed
  ultimately show "x ‚àà iso ?A ?B" using hom xgh.iso_iff unfolding kernel_def by auto
qed

text ‚ÄπThis is then used to derive the isomorphism of two cyclic groups of the same order as a
direct consequence.‚Ä∫

lemma (in cyclic_group) iso_cyclic_groups_same_order:
  assumes "cyclic_group H h" "order G = order H"
  shows "G ‚âÖ H"
proof(intro is_isoI)
  interpret H: cyclic_group H h by fact
  define f where "f = (Œªa. h [^]‚áòH‚áô get_exp gen a)"
  from assms(2) have o: "ord gen = H.ord h" using ord_gen_is_group_order H.ord_gen_is_group_order
    by simp
  have "‚àÄk ‚àà (UNIV::int set). f (gen [^] k) = h [^]‚áòH‚áô k"
  proof
    fix k
    assume k: "k ‚àà (UNIV::int set)"
    have "gen [^] k = gen [^] (SOME x::int. gen [^] k = gen [^] x)"
      by(intro someI_ex[of "Œªx::int. gen [^] k = gen [^] x"]; blast)
    moreover have "(SOME x::int. gen [^] k = gen [^] x) = (SOME x::int. h [^]‚áòH‚áô k = h [^]‚áòH‚áô x)"
    proof -
      have "gen [^] k = gen [^] x ‚ü∑ h [^]‚áòH‚áô k = h [^]‚áòH‚áô x" for x::int
        by (simp add: o group.int_pow_eq)  
      thus ?thesis by simp
    qed
    moreover have "h [^]‚áòH‚áô k = h [^]‚áòH‚áô (SOME x::int. h [^]‚áòH‚áô k = h [^]‚áòH‚áô x)"
      by(intro someI_ex[of "Œªx::int. h [^]‚áòH‚áô k = h [^]‚áòH‚áô x"]; blast)
    ultimately show "f (gen [^] k) = h [^]‚áòH‚áô k" unfolding f_def get_exp_def by metis
  qed
  thus "f ‚àà iso G H"
    using iso_cyclic_groups_generate[OF gen_closed H.gen_closed o H.is_group]
    by (auto simp flip: generator H.generator)
qed

subsection ‚ÄπInteger modular groups‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπWe show that ‚Äπinteger_mod_group‚Ä∫ (written as ‚ÄπZ n‚Ä∫) is in fact a cyclic group.
For $n \neq 1$ it is generated by $1$ and in the other case by $0$.‚Ä∫

notation integer_mod_group ("Z")

lemma Zn_neq1_cyclic_group:
  assumes "n ‚â† 1"
  shows "cyclic_group (Z n) 1"
proof(unfold cyclic_group_def cyclic_group_axioms_def, safe)
  show "group (Z n)" using group_integer_mod_group .
  then interpret group "Z n" .
  show oc: "1 ‚àà carrier (Z n)"
    unfolding integer_mod_group_def integer_group_def using assms by force
  show "x ‚àà generate (Z n) {1}" if "x ‚àà carrier (Z n)" for x
    using generate_pow[OF oc] that int_pow_integer_mod_group solve_equation subgroup_self
    by fastforce
  show "x ‚àà carrier (Z n)" if "x ‚àà generate (Z n) {1}" for x using generate_incl[of "{1}"] that oc
    by fast
qed

lemma Z1_cyclic_group: "cyclic_group (Z 1) 0"
proof(unfold cyclic_group_def cyclic_group_axioms_def, safe)
  show "group (Z 1)" using group_integer_mod_group .
  then interpret group "Z 1" .
  show "0 ‚àà carrier (Z 1)" unfolding integer_mod_group_def by simp
  thus "x ‚àà carrier (Z 1)" if "x ‚àà generate (Z 1) {0}" for x using generate_incl[of "{0}"] that
    by fast
  show "x ‚àà generate (Z 1) {0}" if "x ‚àà carrier (Z 1)" for x
  proof -
    from that have "x = 0" unfolding integer_mod_group_def by auto
    with generate.one[of "Z 1" "{0}"] show "x ‚àà generate (Z 1) {0}" unfolding integer_mod_group_def
      by simp
  qed
qed

lemma Zn_cyclic_group:
  obtains x where "cyclic_group (Z n) x"
  using Z1_cyclic_group Zn_neq1_cyclic_group by metis

text ‚ÄπMoreover, its order is just $n$.‚Ä∫

lemma Zn_order: "order (Z n) = n"
  by (unfold integer_mod_group_def integer_group_def order_def, auto)

text ‚ÄπConsequently, ‚ÄπZ n‚Ä∫ is isomorphic to any cyclic group of order $n$.‚Ä∫

lemma (in cyclic_group) Zn_iso:
  assumes "order G = n"
  shows "G ‚âÖ Z n"
  using Zn_order Zn_cyclic_group iso_cyclic_groups_same_order assms by metis

no_notation integer_mod_group ("Z")
end

Theory DirProds

(*
    File:     DirProds.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU M√ºnchen
*)
section ‚ÄπDirect group product‚Ä∫

theory DirProds
  imports Finite_Product_Extend Group_Hom Finite_And_Cyclic_Groups
begin

notation integer_mod_group ("Z")

text ‚ÄπThe direct group product is defined component-wise and provided in an indexed way.‚Ä∫

definition DirProds :: "('a ‚áí ('b, 'c) monoid_scheme) ‚áí 'a set ‚áí ('a ‚áí 'b) monoid" where
  "DirProds G I = ‚¶á carrier = Pi‚á©E I (carrier ‚àò G),
                   monoid.mult = (Œªx y. restrict (Œªi. x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y i) I),
                   one = restrict (Œªi. ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô) I ‚¶à"

text ‚ÄπBasic lemmas about ‚ÄπDirProds‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_empty:
  "carrier (DirProds f {}) = {ùü≠‚áòDirProds f {}‚áô}"
  unfolding DirProds_def by auto

lemma DirProds_order:
  assumes "finite I"
  shows "order (DirProds G I) = prod (order ‚àò G) I"
  unfolding order_def DirProds_def using assms by (simp add: card_PiE)

lemma DirProds_in_carrI:
  assumes "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ x i ‚àà carrier (G i)" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àâ I ‚üπ x i = undefined"
  shows "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  unfolding DirProds_def using assms by auto

lemma comp_in_carr:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "i ‚àà I"
  shows "x i ‚àà carrier (G i)"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by auto

lemma comp_mult:
  assumes "i ‚àà I"
  shows "(x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y) i = (x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y i)"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by simp

lemma comp_exp_nat:
  fixes k::nat
  assumes "i ‚àà I"
  shows "(x [^]‚áòDirProds G I‚áô k) i = x i [^]‚áòG i‚áô k"
proof (induction k)
  case 0
  then show ?case using assms unfolding DirProds_def by simp
next
  case i: (Suc k)
  have "(x [^]‚áòDirProds G I‚áô k ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x) i = (x [^]‚áòDirProds G I‚áô k) i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x i"
    by(rule comp_mult[OF assms])
  also from i have "‚Ä¶ = x i [^]‚áòG i‚áô k ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x i" by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = x i [^]‚áòG i‚áô Suc k" by simp
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma DirProds_m_closed:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "y ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ group (G i)"
  shows "x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  using assms monoid.m_closed[OF group.is_monoid[OF assms(3)]] unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce

lemma partial_restr:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "J ‚äÜ I"
  shows "restrict a J ‚àà carrier (DirProds G J)"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by auto 

lemma eq_parts_imp_eq:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "b ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ a i = b i"
  shows "a = b"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce

lemma mult_restr:
  assumes "a ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "b ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "J ‚äÜ I"
  shows "a ‚äó‚áòDirProds G J‚áô b = restrict (a ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô b) J"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by force

lemma DirProds_one:
  assumes "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  shows "(‚àÄi ‚àà I. x i = ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô) ‚ü∑ x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô"
  using assms unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce

lemma DirProds_one':
  "i‚ààI ‚üπ ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô i = ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô"
  unfolding DirProds_def by simp

lemma DirProds_one'':
  "ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô = restrict (Œªi. ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô) I"
  by (unfold DirProds_def, simp)

lemma DirProds_mult:
  "(‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô) = (Œªx y. restrict (Œªi. x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y i) I)"
  unfolding DirProds_def by simp

lemma DirProds_one_iso: "(Œªx. x G) ‚àà iso (DirProds f {G}) (f G)"
proof (intro isoI homI)
  show "bij_betw (Œªx. x G) (carrier (DirProds f {G})) (carrier (f G))"
  proof (unfold bij_betw_def, rule)
    show "inj_on (Œªx. x G) (carrier (DirProds f {G}))"
      by (intro inj_onI, unfold DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def, fastforce)
    show "(Œªx. x G) ` carrier (DirProds f {G}) = carrier (f G)"
    proof(intro equalityI subsetI)
      show "x ‚àà carrier (f G)" if "x ‚àà (Œªx. x G) ` carrier (DirProds f {G})" for x
        using that unfolding DirProds_def by auto
      show "x ‚àà (Œªx. x G) ` carrier (DirProds f {G})" if xc: "x ‚àà carrier (f G)" for x
      proof
        show "(Œªk‚àà{G}. x) ‚àà carrier (DirProds f {G})" unfolding DirProds_def using xc by auto
        moreover show "x = (Œªk‚àà{G}. x) G" by simp
      qed
    qed
  qed
qed (unfold DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def, auto)

lemma DirProds_one_cong: "(DirProds f {G}) ‚âÖ (f G)"
  using DirProds_one_iso is_isoI by fast

lemma DirProds_one_iso_sym: "(Œªx. (Œª_‚àà{G}. x)) ‚àà iso (f G) (DirProds f {G})"
proof (intro isoI homI)
  show "bij_betw (Œªx. Œª_‚àà{G}. x) (carrier (f G)) (carrier (DirProds f {G}))"
  proof (unfold bij_betw_def, rule)
    show "inj_on (Œªx. (Œª_‚àà{G}. x)) (carrier (f G))"
      by (intro inj_onI, metis imageI image_constant image_restrict_eq member_remove remove_def)
    show "(Œªx. (Œª_‚àà{G}. x)) ` carrier (f G) = carrier (DirProds f {G})"
      unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce
  qed
qed (unfold DirProds_def, auto)

lemma DirProds_one_cong_sym: "(f G) ‚âÖ (DirProds f {G})"
  using DirProds_one_iso_sym is_isoI by fast

text ‚ÄπThe direct product is a group iff all factors are groups.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_is_group:
  assumes "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ group (G i)"
  shows "group (DirProds G I)"
proof(rule groupI)
  show one_closed: "ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" unfolding DirProds_def
    by (simp add: assms group.is_monoid)
  fix x
  assume x: "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  have one_: "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô = ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô i" unfolding DirProds_def by simp
  have "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x i = x i"
  proof -
    fix i
    assume i: "i ‚àà I"
    interpret group "G i" using assms[OF i] .
    have "x i ‚àà carrier (G i)" using x i comp_in_carr by fast
    thus "ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x i = x i" by(subst one_[OF i, symmetric]; simp)
  qed
  with one_ x show "ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x = x" unfolding DirProds_def by force
  have "restrict (Œªi. inv‚áòG i‚áô (x i)) I ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" using x group.inv_closed[OF assms]
    unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce 
  moreover have "restrict (Œªi. inv‚áòG i‚áô (x i)) I ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô"
    using x group.l_inv[OF assms] unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce
  ultimately show "‚àÉy‚ààcarrier (DirProds G I). y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô" by blast
  fix y
  assume y: "y ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  from DirProds_m_closed[OF x y assms] show m_closed: "x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
    by blast
  fix z
  assume z: "z ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
  have "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z) i
                    = (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z)) i"
  proof -
    fix i
    assume i: "i ‚àà I"
    have "(x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z) i = (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y) i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z i"
      using assms by (simp add: comp_mult i m_closed z)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z i" by (simp add: assms comp_mult i x y)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (y i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z i)" using i assms x y z
      by (meson Group.group_def comp_in_carr monoid.m_assoc)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z)) i" by (simp add: DirProds_def i)
    finally show "(x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z) i
                = (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z)) i" .
  qed
  thus "x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z = x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô z)"
    unfolding DirProds_def by auto
qed

lemma DirProds_obtain_elem_carr:
  assumes "group (DirProds G I)" "i ‚àà I" "x ‚àà carrier (G i)"
  obtains k where "k ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "k i = x"
proof -
  interpret DP: group "DirProds G I" by fact
  from comp_in_carr[OF DP.one_closed] DirProds_one' have ao: "‚àÄj‚ààI. ùü≠‚áòG j‚áô ‚àà carrier (G j)" by metis
  let ?r = "restrict ((Œªj. ùü≠‚áòG j‚áô)(i := x)) I"
  have "?r ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)"
    unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def using assms(2, 3) ao by auto
  moreover have "?r i = x" using assms(2) by simp
  ultimately show "(‚ãÄk. ‚ü¶k ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I); k i = x‚üß ‚üπ thesis) ‚üπ thesis" by blast
qed

lemma DirProds_group_imp_groups:
  assumes "group (DirProds G I)" and i: "i ‚àà I"
  shows "group (G i)"
proof (intro groupI)
  let ?DP = "DirProds G I"
  interpret DP: group ?DP by fact
  show "ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô ‚àà carrier (G i)" using DirProds_one' comp_in_carr[OF DP.one_closed i] i by metis
  show "x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y ‚àà carrier (G i)" if "x ‚àà carrier (G i)" "y ‚àà carrier (G i)" for x y
  proof -
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms that(1)] obtain k where k: "k ‚àà carrier ?DP" "k i = x" .
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms that(2)] obtain l where l: "l ‚àà carrier ?DP" "l i = y" .
    have "k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô l ‚àà carrier ?DP" using k l by fast
    from comp_in_carr[OF this i] comp_mult[OF i] show ?thesis using k l by metis
  qed
  show "x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z = x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z)"
    if x: "x ‚àà carrier (G i)" and y: "y ‚àà carrier (G i)" and z: "z ‚àà carrier (G i)" for x y z
  proof -
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms x] obtain k where k: "k ‚àà carrier ?DP" "k i = x" .
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms y] obtain l where l: "l ‚àà carrier ?DP" "l i = y" .
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms z] obtain m where m: "m ‚àà carrier ?DP" "m i = z" .
    have "x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô z = (k i) ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (l i) ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (m i)" using k l m by argo
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô l ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô m) i" using comp_mult[OF i] k l m by metis
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô (l ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô m)) i"
    proof -
      have "k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô l ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô m = k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô (l ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô m)" using DP.m_assoc[OF k(1) l(1) m(1)] .
      thus ?thesis by simp
    qed
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (k i) ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô ((l i) ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (m i))" using comp_mult[OF i] k l m by metis
    finally show ?thesis using k l m by blast
  qed
  show "ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x = x" if "x ‚àà carrier (G i)" for x
  proof -
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms that(1)] obtain k where k: "k ‚àà carrier ?DP" "k i = x" .
    hence "ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô k = k" by simp
    with comp_mult k DirProds_one[OF DP.one_closed] that i show ?thesis by metis
  qed
  show "‚àÉy‚ààcarrier (G i). y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x = ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô" if "x ‚àà carrier (G i)" for x
  proof -
    from DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF assms that(1)] obtain k where k: "k ‚àà carrier ?DP" "k i = x" .
    hence ic: "inv‚áò?DP‚áô k ‚àà carrier ?DP" by simp
    have "inv‚áò?DP‚áô k ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô k = ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô" using k by simp
    hence "(inv‚áò?DP‚áô k) i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô k i= ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô" using comp_mult[OF i] DirProds_one'[OF i] by metis
    with k(2) comp_in_carr[OF ic i] show ?thesis by blast
  qed
qed

lemma DirProds_group_iff: "group (DirProds G I) ‚ü∑ (‚àÄi‚ààI. group (G i))"
  using DirProds_is_group DirProds_group_imp_groups by metis

lemma comp_inv:
  assumes "group (DirProds G I)" and x: "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" and i: "i ‚àà I"
  shows "(inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x) i = inv‚áò(G i)‚áô (x i)"
proof -
  interpret DP: group "DirProds G I" by fact
  interpret Gi: group "G i" using DirProds_group_imp_groups[OF DP.is_group i] .
  have ixc: "inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" using x by blast
  hence "inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds G I‚áô" using x by simp
  hence "(inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x) i = ùü≠‚áòG i‚áô" by (simp add: DirProds_one' i)
  moreover from comp_mult[OF i]
  have "(inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x) i = ((inv‚áò(DirProds G I)‚áô x) i) ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô (x i)"
    by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis using x ixc by (simp add: comp_in_carr[OF _ i] group.inv_equality)
qed

text ‚ÄπThe same is true for abelian groups.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_is_comm_group:
  assumes "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ comm_group (G i)"
  shows "comm_group (DirProds G I)" (is "comm_group ?DP")
proof
  interpret group ?DP using assms DirProds_is_group unfolding comm_group_def by metis
  show "carrier ?DP ‚äÜ Units ?DP" "ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô ‚àà carrier ?DP" by simp_all
  fix x
  assume x[simp]: "x ‚àà carrier ?DP"
  show "ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô x = x" "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô = x" by simp_all
  fix y
  assume y[simp]: "y ‚àà carrier ?DP"
  show "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y ‚àà carrier ?DP" by simp
  show "x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y = y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x"
  proof (rule eq_parts_imp_eq[of _ G I])
    show "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y ‚àà carrier ?DP" by simp
    show "y ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô x ‚àà carrier ?DP" by simp
    show "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y) i = (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x) i"
    proof -
      fix i
      assume i: "i ‚àà I"
      interpret gi: comm_group "(G i)" using assms(1)[OF i] .
      have "(x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y) i = x i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y i"
        by (intro comp_mult[OF i])
      also have "‚Ä¶ = y i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x i" using comp_in_carr[OF _ i] x y gi.m_comm by metis
      also have "‚Ä¶ = (y ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô x) i" by (intro comp_mult[symmetric, OF i])
      finally show "(x ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô y) i = (y ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô x) i" .
    qed
  qed
  fix z
  assume z[simp]: "z ‚àà carrier ?DP"
  show "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô z = x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô (y ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô z)" using m_assoc by simp
qed

lemma DirProds_comm_group_imp_comm_groups:
  assumes "comm_group (DirProds G I)" and i: "i ‚àà I"
  shows "comm_group (G i)"
proof -
  interpret DP: comm_group "DirProds G I" by fact
  interpret Gi: group "G i" using DirProds_group_imp_groups[OF DP.is_group i] .
  show "comm_group (G i)"
  proof
    show "x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y = y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x" if x: "x ‚àà carrier (G i)" and y: "y ‚àà carrier (G i)" for x y
    proof -
      obtain a where a[simp]: "a ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "a i = x"
        using DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF DP.is_group i x] .
      obtain b where b[simp]: "b ‚àà carrier (DirProds G I)" "b i = y"
        using DirProds_obtain_elem_carr[OF DP.is_group i y] .
      have "a ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô b = b ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô a" using DP.m_comm by simp
      hence "(a ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô b) i = (b ‚äó‚áòDirProds G I‚áô a) i" by argo
      with comp_mult[OF i] have "a i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô b i = b i ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô a i" by metis
      with a b show "x ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô y = y ‚äó‚áòG i‚áô x" by blast
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma DirProds_comm_group_iff: "comm_group (DirProds G I) ‚ü∑ (‚àÄi‚ààI. comm_group (G i))"
  using DirProds_is_comm_group DirProds_comm_group_imp_comm_groups by metis

text ‚ÄπAnd also for finite groups.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_is_finite_group:
  assumes "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ finite_group (G i)" "finite I"
  shows "finite_group (DirProds G I)"
proof -
  have "group (G i)" if "i‚ààI" for i using assms(1)[OF that] unfolding finite_group_def by blast
  from DirProds_is_group[OF this] interpret DP: group "DirProds G I" by fast
  show ?thesis
  proof(unfold_locales)
    have "order (DirProds G I) ‚â† 0"
    proof(unfold DirProds_order[OF assms(2)])
      have "(order ‚àò G) i ‚â† 0" if "i‚ààI" for i
        using assms(1)[OF that] by (simp add: finite_group.order_gt_0)
      thus "prod (order ‚àò G) I ‚â† 0" by (simp add: assms(2))
    qed
    thus "finite (carrier (DirProds G I))" unfolding order_def by (meson card.infinite)
  qed
qed

lemma DirProds_finite_imp_finite_groups:
  assumes "finite_group (DirProds G I)" "finite I"
  shows "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ finite_group (G i)"
proof -
  fix i assume i: "i ‚àà I"
  interpret DP: finite_group "DirProds G I" by fact
  interpret group "G i" by (rule DirProds_group_imp_groups[OF DP.is_group i])
  show "finite_group (G i)"
  proof(unfold_locales)
    have oDP: "order (DirProds G I) ‚â† 0" by blast
    with DirProds_order[OF assms(2), of G] have "order (G i) ‚â† 0" using i assms(2) by force
    thus "finite (carrier (G i))" unfolding order_def by (meson card_eq_0_iff)
  qed
qed

lemma DirProds_finite_group_iff:
  assumes "finite I"
  shows "finite_group (DirProds G I) ‚ü∑ (‚àÄi‚ààI. finite_group (G i))"
  using DirProds_is_finite_group DirProds_finite_imp_finite_groups assms by metis

lemma DirProds_finite_comm_group_iff:
  assumes "finite I"
  shows "finite_comm_group (DirProds G I) ‚ü∑ (‚àÄi‚ààI. finite_comm_group (G i))"
  using DirProds_finite_group_iff[OF assms] DirProds_comm_group_iff unfolding finite_comm_group_def by fast

text ‚ÄπIf a group is an internal direct product of a family of subgroups, it is isomorphic to the
direct product of these subgroups.‚Ä∫

lemma (in comm_group) subgroup_iso_DirProds_IDirProds:
  assumes "subgroup J G" "is_idirprod J S I" "finite I"
  shows "(Œªx. ‚®Ç‚áòG‚áôi‚ààI. x i) ‚àà iso (DirProds (Œªi. G‚¶ácarrier := (S i)‚¶à) I) (G‚¶ácarrier := J‚¶à)"
(is "?fp ‚àà iso ?DP ?J")
proof -
  from assms(2) have assm: "J = IDirProds G S I"
                           "compl_fam S I"
    unfolding is_idirprod_def by auto
  from assms(1, 2) have assm': "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ subgroup (S i) (G‚¶ácarrier := J‚¶à)"
    using normal_imp_subgroup subgroup_incl by (metis IDirProds_incl assms(2) is_idirprod_def)
  interpret J: comm_group ?J using subgroup_is_comm_group[OF assms(1)] .
  interpret DP: comm_group ?DP
    by (intro DirProds_is_comm_group; use J.subgroup_is_comm_group[OF assm'] in simp)
  have inJ: "S i ‚äÜ J" if "i ‚àà I" for i using subgroup.subset[OF assm'[OF that]] by simp
  have hom: "?fp ‚àà hom ?DP ?J"
  proof (rule homI)
    fix x
    assume x[simp]: "x ‚àà carrier ?DP"
    show "finprod G x I ‚àà carrier ?J"
    proof (subst finprod_subgroup[OF _ assms(1)])
      show "x ‚àà I ‚Üí J" using inJ comp_in_carr[OF x] by auto
      thus "finprod ?J x I ‚àà carrier ?J" by (intro J.finprod_closed; simp)
    qed
    fix y
    assume y[simp]: "y ‚àà carrier ?DP"
    show "finprod G (x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y) I = finprod G x I ‚äó‚áò?J‚áô finprod G y I"
    proof(subst (1 2 3) finprod_subgroup[of _ _ J])
      show xyJ: "x ‚àà I ‚Üí J" "y ‚àà I ‚Üí J" using x y inJ comp_in_carr[OF x] comp_in_carr[OF y]
        by auto
      show xyJ1: "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y ‚àà I ‚Üí J" using inJ x y comp_in_carr[of "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y"] by fastforce
      show "subgroup J G" using assms(1) .
      show "finprod ?J (x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y) I = finprod ?J x I ‚äó‚áò?J‚áô finprod ?J y I"
      proof (rule J.finprod_cong_split)
        show "x ‚àà I ‚Üí carrier ?J" "y ‚àà I ‚Üí carrier ?J" using xyJ by simp_all
        show "x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y ‚àà I ‚Üí carrier ?J" using xyJ1 by simp
        fix i
        assume i: "i ‚àà I"
        then have "x i ‚äó‚áòG‚¶ácarrier := (S i) ‚¶à‚áô y i = (x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y) i"
          by (intro comp_mult[symmetric])
        thus "x i ‚äó‚áò?J‚áô y i = (x ‚äó‚áò?DP‚áô y) i" by simp
      qed
    qed
  qed
  then interpret fp: group_hom ?DP ?J ?fp unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def by blast
  have s: "subgroup (S i) G" if "i ‚àà I" for i using incl_subgroup[OF assms(1) assm'[OF that]] .
  have "kernel ?DP ?J ?fp = {ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô}"
  proof -
    have "a = ùü≠‚áò?DP‚áô" if "a ‚àà kernel ?DP ?J ?fp" for a
    proof -
      from that have a: "finprod G a I = ùü≠" "a ‚àà carrier ?DP" unfolding kernel_def by simp_all
      from compl_fam_imp_triv_finprod[OF assm(2) assms(3) s a(1)] comp_in_carr[OF a(2)]
      have "‚àÄi‚ààI. a i = ùü≠" by simp
      then show ?thesis using DirProds_one[OF a(2)] by fastforce
    qed
    thus ?thesis using fp.one_in_kernel by blast
  qed
  moreover have "J ‚äÜ ?fp ` carrier ?DP"
    using assm(1) IDirProds_eq_finprod_PiE[OF assms(3) incl_subgroup[OF assms(1) assm']]
    unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis using hom fp.iso_iff unfolding kernel_def by auto
qed

lemma (in comm_group) iso_DirProds_IDirProds:
  assumes "is_idirprod (carrier G) S I" "finite I"
  shows "(Œªx. ‚®Ç‚áòG‚áôi‚ààI. x i) ‚àà iso (DirProds (Œªi. G‚¶ácarrier := (S i)‚¶à) I) G"
  using subgroup_iso_DirProds_IDirProds[OF subgroup_self assms(1, 2)] by auto

lemma (in comm_group) cong_DirProds_IDirProds:
  assumes "is_idirprod (carrier G) S I" "finite I"
  shows "DirProds (Œªi. G‚¶ácarrier := (S i)‚¶à) I ‚âÖ G"
  by (intro is_isoI, use iso_DirProds_IDirProds[OF assms] in blast)

text ‚ÄπIn order to prove the isomorphism between two direct products, the following lemmas provide
some criterias.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_iso:
  assumes "bij_betw f I J" "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ Gs i ‚âÖ Hs (f i)"
          "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ group (Gs i)" "‚ãÄj. j‚ààJ ‚üπ group (Hs j)"
  shows "DirProds Gs I ‚âÖ DirProds Hs J"
proof -
  interpret DG: group "DirProds Gs I" using DirProds_is_group assms(3) by blast
  interpret DH: group "DirProds Hs J" using DirProds_is_group assms(4) by blast
  from assms(1) obtain g where g: "g = inv_into I f" "bij_betw g J I" by (meson bij_betw_inv_into)
  hence fgi: "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ g (f i) = i" "‚ãÄj. j ‚àà J ‚üπ f (g j) = j"
    using assms(1) bij_betw_inv_into_left[OF assms(1)] bij_betw_inv_into_right[OF assms(1)] by auto
  from assms(2) have "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ (‚àÉh. h ‚àà iso (Gs i) (Hs (f i)))" unfolding is_iso_def by blast
  then obtain h where h: "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà I ‚üπ h i ‚àà iso (Gs i) (Hs (f i))" by metis
  let ?h = "(Œªx. (Œªj. if j‚ààJ then (h (g j)) (x (g j)) else undefined))"
  have hc: "?h x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Hs J)" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" for x
  proof -
    have xc: "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" by fact
    have "h (g j) (x (g j)) ‚àà carrier (Hs j)" if "j ‚àà J" for j
    proof(intro iso_in_carr[OF _ comp_in_carr[OF xc], of "h (g j)" "g j" "Hs j"])
      show "g j ‚àà I" using g(2)[unfolded bij_betw_def] that by blast
      from h[OF this] show "h (g j) ‚àà Group.iso (Gs (g j)) (Hs j)" using fgi(2)[OF that] by simp
    qed
    thus ?thesis using xc unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def extensional_def by auto
  qed
  moreover have "?h (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Gs I‚áô y)= ?h x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Hs J‚áô ?h y"
    if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" "y ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" for x y
  proof(intro eq_parts_imp_eq[OF hc[OF DG.m_closed[OF that]] DH.m_closed[OF hc[OF that(1)] hc[OF that(2)]]])
    fix j
    assume j: "j ‚àà J"
    hence gj: "g j ‚àà I" using g unfolding bij_betw_def by blast
    from assms(3)[OF gj] assms(4)[OF j] have g: "group (Gs (g j))" "Group.group (Hs j)" .
    from iso_imp_homomorphism[OF h[OF gj]] fgi(2)[OF j] g
    interpret hjh: group_hom "Gs (g j)" "Hs j" "h (g j)"
      unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def by simp
    show "(?h (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Gs I‚áô y)) j = (?h x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Hs J‚áô ?h y) j"
    proof(subst comp_mult)
      show "(if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (x (g j) ‚äó‚áòGs (g j)‚áô y (g j)) else undefined)
          = (?h x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Hs J‚áô ?h y) j"
      proof(subst comp_mult)
        have "h (g j) (x (g j) ‚äó‚áòGs (g j)‚áô y (g j)) = h (g j) (x (g j)) ‚äó‚áòHs j‚áô h (g j) (y (g j))"
          using comp_in_carr[OF that(1) gj] comp_in_carr[OF that(2) gj] by simp
        thus "(if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (x (g j) ‚äó‚áòGs (g j)‚áô y (g j)) else undefined) =
              (if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (x (g j)) else undefined)
      ‚äó‚áòHs j‚áô (if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (y (g j)) else undefined)"
          using j by simp
      qed (use j g that hc in auto)
    qed (use gj g that in auto)
  qed
  ultimately interpret hgh: group_hom "DirProds Gs I" "DirProds Hs J" ?h
    unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def by (auto intro: homI)
  have "carrier (DirProds Hs J) ‚äÜ ?h ` carrier (DirProds Gs I)"
  proof
    show "x ‚àà ?h ` carrier (DirProds Gs I)" if xc: "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Hs J)" for x
    proof -
      from h obtain k where k: "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ k i = inv_into (carrier (Gs i)) (h i)" by fast
      hence kiso: "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ k i ‚àà iso (Hs (f i)) (Gs i)"
        using h by (simp add: assms(3) group.iso_set_sym)
      hence hk: "y = (h (g j) ‚àò (k (g j))) y" if "j ‚àà J" "y ‚àà carrier (Hs j)" for j y
      proof -
        have gj: "g j ‚àà I" using that g[unfolded bij_betw_def] by blast
        thus ?thesis
          using h[OF gj, unfolded iso_def] k[OF gj] that fgi(2)[OF that(1)] bij_betw_inv_into_right
          unfolding comp_def by fastforce
      qed
      let ?k = "(Œªi. if i‚ààI then k i else (Œª_. undefined))"
      let ?y = "(Œªi. (?k i) (x (f i)))"
      have "x j = (Œªj. if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (?y (g j)) else undefined) j" for j
      proof (cases "j ‚àà J")
        case True
        thus ?thesis using hk[OF True comp_in_carr[OF that True]]
                           fgi(2)[OF True] g[unfolded bij_betw_def] by auto
      next
        case False
        thus ?thesis using that[unfolded DirProds_def] by auto
      qed
      moreover have "?y ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)"
      proof -
        have "?y i ‚àà carrier (Gs i)" if i: "i ‚àà I" for i
          using k[OF i] h[OF i] comp_in_carr[OF xc] assms(1) bij_betwE iso_in_carr kiso that
          by fastforce
        moreover have "?y i = undefined" if i: "i ‚àâ I" for i using i by simp
        ultimately show ?thesis unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by simp
      qed
      ultimately show ?thesis by fast
    qed
  qed
  moreover have "x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds Gs I‚áô"
    if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" "?h x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds Hs J‚áô" for x
  proof -
    have "‚àÄi‚ààI. x i = ùü≠‚áòGs i‚áô"
    proof
      fix i
      assume i: "i ‚àà I"
      interpret gi: group "Gs i" using assms(3)[OF i] .
      interpret hfi: group "Hs (f i)" using assms(4) i assms(1)[unfolded bij_betw_def] by blast
      from h[OF i] interpret hi: group_hom "(Gs i)" "Hs (f i)" "h i"
        unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def iso_def by blast
      from that have hx: "?h x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Hs J)" by simp
      from DirProds_one[OF this] that(2)
      have "(if j ‚àà J then h (g j) (x (g j)) else undefined) = ùü≠‚áòHs j‚áô" if "j ‚àà J" for j
        using that by blast
      hence "h (g (f i)) (x (g (f i))) = ùü≠‚áòHs (f i)‚áô" using i assms(1)[unfolded bij_betw_def] by auto
      hence "h i (x i) = ùü≠‚áòHs (f i)‚áô" using fgi(1)[OF i] by simp
      with hi.iso_iff h[OF i] comp_in_carr[OF that(1) i] show "x i = ùü≠‚áòGs i‚áô" by fast
    qed
    with DirProds_one that show ?thesis using assms(3) by blast
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis unfolding is_iso_def using hgh.iso_iff by blast
qed

lemma DirProds_iso1:
  assumes "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ Gs i ‚âÖ (f ‚àò Gs) i" "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ group (Gs i)" "‚ãÄi. i‚ààI ‚üπ group ((f ‚àò Gs) i)"
  shows "DirProds Gs I ‚âÖ DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I"
proof -
  interpret DP: group "DirProds Gs I" using DirProds_is_group assms by metis
  interpret fDP: group "DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I" using DirProds_is_group assms by metis
  from assms have "‚àÄi‚ààI. (‚àÉg. g ‚àà iso (Gs i) ((f ‚àò Gs) i))" unfolding is_iso_def by blast
  then obtain J where J: "‚àÄi‚ààI. J i ‚àà iso (Gs i) ((f ‚àò Gs) i)" by metis
  let ?J = "(Œªi. if i‚ààI then J i else (Œª_. undefined))"
  from J obtain K where K: "‚àÄi‚ààI. K i = inv_into (carrier (Gs i)) (J i)" by fast
  hence K_iso: "‚àÄi‚ààI. K i ‚àà iso ((f ‚àò Gs) i) (Gs i)" using group.iso_set_sym assms J by metis
  let ?K = "(Œªi. if i‚ààI then K i else (Œª_. undefined))"
  have JKi: "(?J i) ((?K i) (x i)) = x i" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" for i x
  proof -
    have "(J i) ((K i) (x i)) = x i" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" "i ‚àà I" for i x
    proof -
      from J that have "(J i) ` (carrier (Gs i)) = carrier ((f ‚àò Gs) i)"
        unfolding iso_def bij_betw_def by blast
      hence "‚àÉy. y ‚àà carrier (Gs i) ‚àß (J i) y = x i" using that by (metis comp_in_carr imageE)
      with someI_ex[OF this] that show "(J i) ((K i) (x i)) = x i"
        using K J K_iso unfolding inv_into_def by auto
    qed
    moreover have "(?J i) ((K i) (x i)) = x i" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" "i ‚àâ I" for i x
      using that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def extensional_def by force
    ultimately show ?thesis using that by simp
  qed
  let ?r = "(Œªe. restrict (Œªi. ?J i (e i)) I)"
  have hom: "?r ‚àà hom (DirProds Gs I) (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)"
  proof (intro homI)
    show "?r x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" for x
      using that J comp_in_carr[OF that] unfolding DirProds_def iso_def bij_betw_def by fastforce
    show "?r (x ‚äó‚áòDirProds Gs I‚áô y) = ?r x ‚äó‚áòDirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I‚áô ?r y"
      if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" "y ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" for x y
      using that J comp_in_carr[OF that(1)] comp_in_carr[OF that(2)]
      unfolding DirProds_def iso_def hom_def by force
  qed
  then interpret r: group_hom "(DirProds Gs I)" "(DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" ?r
    unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def by blast
  have "carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I) ‚äÜ ?r ` carrier (DirProds Gs I)"
  proof
    show "x ‚àà ?r ` carrier (DirProds Gs I)" if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" for x
    proof
      show "x = (Œªi‚ààI. ?J i ((?K i) (x i)))"
        using JKi[OF that] that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def by (simp add: extensional_restrict)
      show "(Œªi. ?K i (x i)) ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" using K_iso iso_in_carr that
        unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by fastforce
    qed
  qed
  moreover have "x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds Gs I‚áô"
    if "x ‚àà carrier (DirProds Gs I)" "?r x = ùü≠‚áòDirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I‚áô" for x
  proof -
    have "‚àÄi‚ààI. x i = ùü≠‚áòGs i‚áô"
    proof
      fix i
      assume i: "i ‚àà I"
      with J assms interpret Ji: group_hom "(Gs i)" "(f ‚àò Gs) i" "J i"
        unfolding group_hom_def group_hom_axioms_def iso_def by blast
      from that have rx: "?r x ‚àà carrier (DirProds (f ‚àò Gs) I)" by simp
      from i DirProds_one[OF this] that
      have "(Œªi‚ààI. (if i ‚àà I then J i else (Œª_. undefined)) (x i)) i = ùü≠‚áò(f ‚àò Gs) i‚áô" by blast
      hence "(J i) (x i) = ùü≠‚áò(f ‚àò Gs) i‚áô" using i by simp
      with Ji.iso_iff mp[OF spec[OF J[unfolded Ball_def]] i] comp_in_carr[OF that(1) i]
      show "x i = ùü≠‚áòGs i‚áô" by fast
    qed
    with DirProds_one[OF that(1)] show ?thesis by blast
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis unfolding is_iso_def using r.iso_iff by blast
qed

lemma DirProds_iso2:
  assumes "inj_on f A" "group (DirProds g (f ` A))"
  shows "DirProds (g ‚àò f) A ‚âÖ DirProds g (f ` A)"
proof (intro DirProds_iso[of f])
  show "bij_betw f A (f ` A)" using assms(1) unfolding bij_betw_def by blast
  show "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà A ‚üπ (g ‚àò f) i ‚âÖ g (f i)" unfolding comp_def using iso_refl by simp
  from assms(2) show "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà (f ` A) ‚üπ group (g i)" using DirProds_group_imp_groups by fast
  with assms(1) show "‚ãÄi. i ‚àà A ‚üπ group ((g ‚àò f) i)" by auto
qed

text ‚ÄπThe direct group product distributes when nested.‚Ä∫

lemma DirProds_Sigma:
  "DirProds (Œªi. DirProds (G i) (J i)) I ‚âÖ DirProds (Œª(i,j). G i j) (Sigma I J)" (is "?L ‚âÖ ?R")
proof (intro is_isoI isoI)
  let ?f = "Œªx. restrict (case_prod x) (Sigma I J)"
  show hom: "?f ‚àà hom ?L ?R"
  proof(intro homI)
    show "?f a ‚àà carrier ?R" if "a ‚àà carrier ?L" for a
      using that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by auto
    show "?f (a ‚äó‚áò?L‚áô b) = ?f a ‚äó‚áò?R‚áô ?f b" if "a ‚àà carrier ?L" and "b ‚àà carrier ?L" for a b
      using that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by auto
  qed
  show "bij_betw ?f (carrier ?L) (carrier ?R)"
  proof (intro bij_betwI)
    let ?g = "Œªx. (Œªi. if i‚ààI then (Œªj. if j‚àà(J i) then x(i, j) else undefined) else undefined)"
    show "?f ‚àà carrier ?L ‚Üí carrier ?R" unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce
    show "?g ‚àà carrier ?R ‚Üí carrier ?L" unfolding DirProds_def by fastforce
    show "?f (?g x) = x" if "x ‚àà carrier ?R" for x
      using that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by auto
    show "?g (?f x) = x" if "x ‚àà carrier ?L" for x
      using that unfolding DirProds_def PiE_def Pi_def extensional_def by force
  qed
qed

no_notation integer_mod_group ("Z")

end

Theory Group_Relations

(*
    File:     Group_Relations.thy
    Author:   Joseph Thommes, TU M√ºnchen
*)
section ‚ÄπGroup relations‚Ä∫

theory Group_Relations
  imports Finite_Product_Extend
begin

text ‚ÄπWe introduce the notion of a relation of a set of elements: a way to express the neutral
element by using only powers of said elements. The following predicate describes the set of all the
relations that one can construct from a set of elements.‚Ä∫

definition (in comm_group) relations :: "'a set ‚áí ('a ‚áí int) set" where
  "relations A = {f. finprod G (Œªa. a [^] f a) A = ùü≠} ‚à© extensional A"

text ‚ÄπNow some basic lemmas about relations.‚Ä∫

lemma (in comm_group) in_relationsI[intro]:
  assumes "finprod G (Œªa. a [^] f a) A = ùü≠" "f ‚àà extensional A"
  shows "f ‚àà relations A"
  unfolding relations_def using assms by blast

lemma (in comm_group) triv_rel:
  "restrict (Œª_. 0::int) A ‚àà relations A"
proof
  show "(‚®Ça‚ààA. a [^] (Œª_‚ààA. 0::int) a) = ùü≠" by (intro finprod_one_eqI, simp)
qed simp

lemma (in comm_group) not_triv_relI:
  assumes "a ‚àà A" "f a ‚â† (0::int)"
  shows "f ‚â† (Œª_‚ààA. 0::int)"
  using assms by auto

lemma (in comm_group) rel_in_carr:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ carrier G" "r ‚àà relations A"
  shows "(Œªa. a [^] r a) ‚àà A ‚Üí carrier G"
  by (meson Pi_I assms(1) int_pow_closed subsetD)

text ‚ÄπThe following lemmas are of importance when proving the fundamental theorem of finitely
generated abelian groups in the case that there is just the trivial relation between a set of
generators. They all build up to the last lemma that then is actually used in the proof.‚Ä∫

lemma (in comm_group) relations_zero_imp_pow_not_one:
  assumes "a ‚àà A" "‚àÄf‚àà(relations A). f a = 0"
  shows "‚àÄz::int ‚â† 0. a [^] z ‚â† ùü≠"
proof (rule ccontr; safe)
  fix z::int
  assume z: "z ‚â† 0" "a [^] z = ùü≠"
  have "restrict ((Œªx. 0)(a := z)) A ‚àà relations A"
    by (intro in_relationsI finprod_one_eqI, use z in auto)
  thus False using z assms by auto
qed

lemma (in comm_group) relations_zero_imp_ord_zero:
  assumes "a ‚àà A" "‚àÄf‚àà(relations A). f a = 0"
  and "a ‚àà carrier G"
  shows "ord a = 0"
